metadata.subject: Alternative Asset Managers: Can Alts Unlock Value with C-Corp Conversions?

financial_entities: Morgan Stanley Mexico, Casa de Bolsa, S.A. de C.V.
Morgan Stanley Private Wealth Management Limited
Morgan Stanley India Company Private Limited
Morgan Stanley Wealth Management Australia Pty Ltd
Morgan Stanley MUFG Securities Co., Ltd.
Morgan Stanley Capital Group Japan Co., Ltd
Morgan Stanley Asia (Singapore) Securities Pte Ltd

relationships.description: Morgan Stanley provides research coverage and analysis on Apollo Global Management
Morgan Stanley provides research coverage and analysis on Ares Management
Morgan Stanley provides research coverage and analysis on Blackstone

analysis.purpose: To analyze the potential valuation impact if alternative asset managers convert from partnership structures to C-corporations
analysis.significance: This research report provides detailed financial analysis on how C-corp conversions could unlock value for alternative asset managers, with specific focus on APO and ARES

notable_quotes: We think APO could unlock the most value by converting to a C-corp with 26% in our upside case vs. -14% in our downside case.
ARES could be the first to convert, but this is largely priced in with shares up 23.5% YTD.
The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act could accelerate cost-benefit analyses and decision-making by management teams as a 21% federal tax rate vs. 35% previously implies less tax leakage.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this financial research report

illegal_activity.description: This is a legitimate financial research report from Morgan Stanley analyzing corporate structure conversions, with no evidence of illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a publicly released Morgan Stanley research report analyzing alternative asset managers and potential C-corp conversions, which would be of interest to financial media and investors

analysis.summary: Morgan Stanley research report analyzing the potential valuation impact if alternative asset managers convert from partnership structures to C-corporations. The report identifies Apollo Global Management (APO) as having the most potential upside (26%) from conversion, while Ares Management (ARES) may be first to convert but has already priced in much of the benefit. The analysis focuses on how fee-related earnings could re-rate higher in a C-corp structure.
